name: cryogenically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the freezing of dead human bodies, cells, or body parts at very low temperatures: The blood in the umbilical cord was cryogenically frozen in hopes of using stem cells from it in a bone marrow transplant. Stem cells are taken from valuable racehorse foals at birth and cryogenically stored in case of injury later in their lives.
physics
  specialized in a way that relates to the scientific study of very low temperatures and how to produce them: Helium is cryogenically distilled out of natural gas to produce the helium we put in balloons. Each blade is then cryogenically cooled. See
cryogenic
